perturbation.original_text:
WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding
Agreement dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so
amended, the "Agreement");
perturbation.changed_text:
WHEREAS, PCQ and ABW have executed that certain Co-Branding
Agreement dated October 11, 1996, as amended on December 10, 1996 (as so
amended, the "Agreement") or as they recall;
perturbation.explanation: Adding 'or as they recall' introduces ambiguity about the validity of the referenced agreement. The implication is that the parties' recollection is sufficient even if there are discrepancies with the actual written agreement. This undermines the certainty that the original agreement should provide.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - specifically the parol evidence rule, which prioritizes written agreements over recollections

perturbation.original_text:
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, of the mutual
promises for the parties contained herein and of other good valuable
consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged,
the parties hereto, intending legally to be bound, hereby covenant and agree
as follows:
perturbation.changed_text:
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, of the mutual
promises for the parties contained herein and of other consideration, the receipt of which is acknowledged, the parties hereto, hoping to be bound, hereby consider to agree as follows:
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'good valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the parties hereto, intending legally to be bound, hereby covenant and agree' to 'other consideration, the receipt of which is acknowledged, the parties hereto, hoping to be bound, hereby consider to agree' introduces doubt about the consideration’s value and whether the parties truly intend to be legally bound. The language is weakened from a covenant and agreement to an aspiration to agree, which is problematic for establishing a binding legal obligation.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - specifically relating to the essential elements of a contract (consideration and intent to be bound)

perturbation.original_text:
3. To the extent, if any, that provision of this Agreement
conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision
of this Second Amendment shall prevail and govern for all purposes and in all
respects.
perturbation.changed_text:
3. To the extent it is thought that any provision of this Agreement
conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision
of this Second Amendment might govern.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'To the extent, if any, that provision of this Agreement conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision of this Second Amendment shall prevail and govern for all purposes and in all respects' to 'To the extent it is thought that any provision of this Agreement conflicts with or differs from any provision of the Agreement, such provision of this Second Amendment might govern' changes a definitive statement of legal precedence into a vague possibility. Replacing 'shall prevail and govern' with 'might govern' creates uncertainty about which document controls in the event of a conflict.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law - Rules of contract interpretation and precedence of amendments.
